act: Prevention of Damage by Rabbits Act 1939
Prevention of Damage by Rabbits Act 1939
section_title: Provisions as to use of poison in rabbit holes.
section_text: 4 A person shall not be guilty of an offence under section eight of the  Protection of Animals Act, 1911, by reason only that he uses poisonous gas in a rabbit hole, or places in a rabbit hole a substance which, by evaporation or in contact with moisture generates poisonous gas.

act: Prevention of Damage by Rabbits Act 1939
section_title: Prohibition of use of spring traps above ground.
section_text: 5 1 . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .  2 So much of section six of the  Ground Game Act, 1880, as provides that no person having a right to kill ground game shall, for the purpose of killing ground game . . .   employ poison shall cease to have effect.

act: Prevention of Damage by Rabbits Act 1939
section_text: 6 1 This Act may be cited as the Prevention of Damage by Rabbits Act, 1939. 2 . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 3 This Act shall not extend to Scotland, to Northern Ireland or to the administrative county of London.
